[[Aluf]] '''Ehud Shani''' (born May 9, 1957) is a general in the [[Israel Defense Forces]] and a former Head of [[C4I Corps|C4I]] and Senior Field Commander. Born in [[Haifa]], Shani went to "Reali" High School, a military boarding school. He first joined the IDF [[Israeli Armor Corps|Armor Corps]] in 1975 as an elisted soldier, but the following year he attended Officers School to become an officer. He was the Deputy Commander of an armor battalion during the [[1982 Lebanon War]]. In 1982 he also took a break from his military career to study at [[Bar-Ilan University]], where he received a B.A. in Economics and Social Science. Returning to service, he continued to climb the chain of command. Shani moved to [[Fort Monroe]], [[Virginia]] in 1991 as an Israeli Liaison officer, but returned to Israel in 1994 to become the commander of a tank brigade. He was promoted to Brigadier General in May of 2000 when he was appointed the head of the Armor Corps. In December 2003 he was appointed to his current post after serving two years as the head of the "Plada" (steel) Formation, an armored division.
